verses.roman:
kahite cāhaye kichu, nā āise uttara
tabe vicāraye mane ha-iyā phāṅphara

synonyms: kahite—to speak; cāhaye—wants; kichu—something; nā—not; āise—comes; uttara—any reply; tabe—thereafter; vicāraye—considers; mane—within the mind; ha-iyā—becoming; phāṅphara—puzzled.
translation: He wanted to say something, but no reply could come from his mouth. He then began to consider this puzzle within his mind.
